questions.question_text:
A company is negotiating with a vendor for better prices on several items. The company has made late payments to the vendor in the past.
You need to configure the system to help ensure that all future payments will be made on time.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
1. Open the customer list: This is the first action because you need to access the list where you can apply filters and find all your customers.

2. Open the filter pane. Then select the No. field and set the filter to %MYCUSTOMERS: This action filters the list to only show the customers that belong to the "My Customers" list.

3. Add the Date Filter as a Filter total. Then enter W..CY..W: This action sets a filter for the year-to-date range. 'W..CY..W' is a typical filter to show the start of the week to the current year week.

4. Save the view by naming it Sales for my customers this year: Finally, saving the view with a descriptive name allows you to easily access this specific filter setup in the future.
I would go with Y in this scenario but more logical choice would be -CY..T but that's not an option.
Y is correct because you are going to save for this year at the end. what they actually mean is the current year and not year to date

In BC22 there is no My customers window on the role page of sales order processor. Although I can add it to the Users page, but I cannot add a customer.
In the customer list I cannot set filter for No. field to %mycustomers. The filter disappears immediately.

comments.content: You have the option to select the Accounts Receivable Administrator role center, where you'll locate the customer list. Select your preferred customers. On the customer list page, apply a filter to the 'No' field using '%mycustomers'. This action will apply the filter to the previously established list.

discussion.content:
giving in Y gives: 01/01/23..12/31/23 (01-01-23..31-12-2023)
Giving W-CY..W gives: 01/01/23..04/23/2023 (01-01-23..23-04-2023)
Y is wrong, because you need year to date.

comments.content: I agree with you. Refering to the name of the view : "Sales for my custumer this year ". So we have to filter on the year. The answer is correct.

discussion.content: I think with given scenario answer is correct, no need to filter W-CY..W as it will filter only from current month of the current year. so Y is more logical.
yes the third step is wrong. it should be W-CY..W

comments.content:
Can you please give a detail explanation of W-CY..W ?
W: Week
CY : Current Year (end of year)
.. : and
W: Week

I am not able to interprete when i put all together

discussion.content:
The third step is wrong:
It should de using "W-CY..W" filter instead of "Y" as filter, because in questions it is asking for year-to-date and not for complete year. So the filter "W-CY..W" makes more sense.

questions.question_text:
You are implementing Dynamics 365 Business Central for a company.
The company often invoices multiple shipments on one invoice.
You need to train the accounting staff how to process these sales invoices.
In which two ways should you train the staff to create invoices? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
Letra D e E são corretas. A função combinar remessa faz tudo que diz na E. Porém na C, precisaria de um jobqueue para fazer a exclusão das ordens de compras faturas. A letra B, ainda não tentei obter vendas de uns e faturas para outros.

C,D

Selected Answer: BD
B, D correct

BD
Option "A" I believe incorrect as it says "...invoices and credit memo". When you check the line definitions in the Combine shipments batch job, it looks it is only about invoices.
E maybe is not correct, because it does not "print" invoices (?).

Selected Answer: BD
B. Create a new invoice for the Bill-to-Customer. Use the Get Shipment Lines action to select all the shipments from different sales orders and Sell-to-Customers.

D. Create a new invoice for the Sell-to Customer. Use the Get Shipment Lines action to select all the shipments from different sales orders, in the same currency.

The other options (A, C, and E) involve using the Combine Shipments batch job, which is not typically used for creating invoices in Dynamics 365 Business Central.

Selected Answer: DE
correct
Correct answers should be B & D there is no option to combine shipment with credit memo of a customer.

comments.content:
B is wrong because the bill-to customer should then be the same as the sell-to customer. Qouted from Microsoft:
"If you have shipped orders where the Sell-to Customer No. is different from the Bill-to Customer No., those lines are not displayed in the Get Shipment Lines report. Use personalisation to add the Sell-to Customer field to the page and remove the filter. Now you can add shipment lines to the invoice regardless of the value in the Sell-to Customer No. field, as long as the Bill-to Customer No. field on the shipment lines matches the value on the sales invoice."

discussion.content:
Should it be B and D?
A - credit memos is wrong
C - does not delete automatically completed sales orders
E - does not print sales invoices
Should it be D/E?

choices.B: Create a new invoice for the Bill-to-Customer. Use the Get Shipment Lines action to select all the shipments from different sales orders and Sell-to-Customers.
choices.D: Create a new invoice for the Sell-to Customer. Use the Get Shipment Lines action to select all the shipments from different sales orders, in the same currency.
choices.E: Use the Combine Shipments batch job to automatically create, post, and print sales invoices.
choices.A: Use the Combine Shipments batch job to automatically create and post sales invoices and credit memos.
choices.C: Use the Combine Shipments batch job to automatically create sales invoices and delete completed sales orders.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answers are:

B. Calculate Posting Date from Applies-to-Doc Due Date
C. Applies-to-Doc Due Date Offset

Here's a brief explanation of each:

B. Calculate Posting Date from Applies-to-Doc Due Date: This field should be set to "Yes" to calculate the payment date based on the due date of the invoice.

C. Applies-to-Doc Due Date Offset: This field should be set to "-2" to ensure that the payment date is two days before the invoice due date.
